features.process_name: Build and Rate Policy Offers with Premium Calculation
features.action: generate rated policy offers with calculated premiums through automated rating and validation workflows
features.value: I can present accurate, compliant policy options to customers with transparent pricing and premium breakdowns
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **generate rated policy offers with calculated premiums through automated rating and validation workflows**,
So that **I can present accurate, compliant policy options to customers with transparent pricing and premium breakdowns**
features.business_context:
- Automates complex premium calculation and offer generation, reducing manual rating errors and processing time
- Enables dynamic offer manipulation and re-rating to support quote negotiations and coverage adjustments
- Centralizes premium storage for consistent pricing across policy lifecycle and downstream systems
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Policy Data Collection Completion**
Upon completing initial policy data gathering, system transitions policy to offer-building readiness state.

**2. Offer Generation and Rating Execution**
System invokes rating engine with policy data, calculates premiums using configured rating rules, and generates available coverage offers.

**3. Offer Validation and Compliance Check**
System validates generated offers against business rules and regulatory requirements before presenting options.

**4. Offer Manipulation and Re-Rating**
User is able to rebuild offers with modified parameters or derive alternative coverage combinations, triggering recalculation.

**5. Premium Consolidation and Storage**
System stores calculated premiums centrally for consistent access across policy transactions and reporting.
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Successful Offer Generation**
Given policy data is complete, When offer build command is triggered, Then system transitions to offered state and generates rated coverage options.

**2. Accurate Premium Calculation**
Given rating rules are configured, When offers are generated, Then system calculates premiums matching business rating logic.

**3. Offer Validation Enforcement**
Given offers are generated, When validation is executed, Then system prevents progression if offers violate business or regulatory rules.

**4. Re-Rating Capability**
Given existing offers exist, When rebuild is requested with changed parameters, Then system recalculates premiums reflecting modifications.

**5. Premium Data Accessibility**
Given premiums are calculated, When stored centrally, Then premium data is accessible for policy transactions and downstream systems.

features.process_name: Rebuild Offers During Quote Lifecycle Changes

features.description:

features.business_context:
- Ensures offer integrity and pricing accuracy throughout the quote-to-bind journey as underwriting or coverage details evolve
- Eliminates manual recalculation errors and reduces processing time when policy attributes change mid-lifecycle
- Supports dynamic product configurations and real-time premium adjustments aligned with regulatory and business rules
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Offer Lifecycle Orchestration**
System transitions quote from data gathering to offered state upon triggering offer build command.

**2. Automated Offer Reconstruction**
When quote data changes, system automatically rebuilds offers, derives new offer data, and validates against business rules.

Upon completion of rebuild, system validates offer integrity and persists approved offers for selection.

System coordinates with external rules engines and service registries to execute product-specific transformations and retrieve configuration.
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Successful Offer Rebuild**
Given quote data has changed, When rebuild command is triggered, Then system generates updated offers with recalculated premiums.

**2. State Transition Enforcement**
Given quote is in data gathering state, When offer build completes successfully, Then system transitions quote to offered state.

**3. Validation Failure Handling**
Given rebuilt offers fail validation rules, When validation executes, Then system prevents state transition and flags errors for review.

**4. Premium Calculation Accuracy**
Given policy attributes are modified, When rating and proration services execute, Then system reflects updated premiums in rebuilt offers.

**5. Service Availability Assurance**
Given external rules services are required, When offer rebuild initiates, Then system successfully invokes registered services from service registry.

features.business_context:

features.key_capabilities:

features.value: the system maintains accurate offer versions, enables selection of appropriate coverage options, and ensures data integrity throughout the quoting and proposal process
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **manage offer variations and track their lifecycle states across all lines of business**,
So that **the system maintains accurate offer versions, enables selection of appropriate coverage options, and ensures data integrity throughout the quoting and proposal process**.
features.business_context:
- Supports multi-variation offer management across all product lines with independent state tracking separate from quote lifecycle
- Eliminates manual tracking overhead by automatically maintaining rule versions and offer selection indicators

features.key_capabilities:
**Offer Initialization and Identification**
System creates unique offer variations identified by offer codes and initializes them in OFFERED state for customer consideration.

**Offer Rating and Progression**
Upon business rule application, system transitions offers through RATED state and advances to PROPOSED when finalized for binding.

System tracks rule versions from rating engine to ensure consistency and auditability across offer lifecycle changes.

**Offer Selection Tracking**
When multiple variations exist, system marks the selected option enabling clear identification of customer choice among alternatives.

**Exception State Handling**
If offers become invalid or require recalculation, system transitions to exception states triggering appropriate reprocessing workflows.
features.acceptance_criteria:

Given an initialized offer, when rating rules are applied and proposal is created, then system progresses state from OFFERED through RATED to PROPOSED sequentially.

**Version Tracking Accuracy**
Given rule engine updates, when offers are rated, then system records behavior version number ensuring traceability to specific rule sets.

**Selection Indicator Management**
Given multiple offer variations, when one is selected, then system sets selection flag exclusively for chosen option while maintaining all alternatives.

**Exception State Transition**
Given invalid data or calculation errors, when offer processing fails, then system assigns exception state preventing progression until resolved.

**Multi-Product Scope**
Given offers across different lines of business, when managed through system, then all product types utilize consistent state tracking mechanisms.

features.feature: Configure Multi-Currency Support for Insurance Products
features.source_document: GRC_Policy/Policy/Policy Processes and Capabilities/Policy Common Capabilities/Support Other Currencies Besides USD.md
features.evidence: The system needs to support configuring Products/Packages/Coverages with different currencies besides USD. Users are able to select the wanted quote currency from UI. Currency can be used to configure OpenL Offer Specifications. Marked 'currencyCd' as Dimension and OfferContext in Product Data Model.
features.process_name: Multi-Currency Insurance Product Configuration
features.action: configure insurance products to support multiple currencies for quotes and premium calculations
features.value: the organization can expand market reach by offering currency-flexible products without geographic restrictions, enabling cross-border sales and investment options
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **configure insurance products to support multiple currencies for quotes and premium calculations**,
So that **the organization can expand market reach by offering currency-flexible products without geographic restrictions, enabling cross-border sales and investment options**
features.business_context:
- Insurance products require multi-currency capability to serve diverse markets, allowing applicants to purchase policies in their preferred currency regardless of location
- Investment-linked products must support currency flexibility where policy currency does not restrict available investment fund denominations
- Current system limitation restricts products to USD only, preventing competitive positioning in international markets and limiting product accessibility
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Currency Selection and Quote Initialization**
User initiates quote creation and designates target currency from available options. System establishes currency as permanent dimension for entire policy lifecycle, preventing modification after quote creation.

**2. Product Configuration Filtering**
Upon currency selection, system applies filtering logic to determine eligible packages, products, and coverages compatible with chosen currency through dimensional lookup.

**3. Premium Calculation Engine Integration**
System passes currency attribute through policy mapping layer to rating engine. Calculation engine processes premiums using currency-specific rules and configurations.

**4. Monetary Value Standardization**
When presenting default values for coverage amounts and benefit levels, system automatically expresses all monetary attributes in selected quote currency rather than system default currency.
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Currency Immutability Post-Creation**
Given a quote has been created with designated currency, When user attempts to modify currency selection, Then system prevents change and maintains original currency throughout policy lifecycle.

**2. Currency-Driven Product Availability**
Given multiple currency options are configured, When user selects specific currency during quote initialization, Then system displays only packages and products configured for that currency dimension.

**3. Multi-Currency Premium Calculation**
Given quote currency is established, When premium calculation is triggered, Then rating engine processes all monetary computations in selected currency and stores results accordingly.

**4. Monetary Display Consistency**
Given monetary attributes have default values configured, When system presents these values to user, Then all amounts display with correct currency symbol matching quote currency selection.

features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **configure and calculate premiums using multiple currencies for insurance products**,
So that **the organization can expand into global markets with flexible currency-specific product offerings while ensuring accurate premium calculations**
features.business_context:
- Insurance carriers require multi-currency capabilities to offer products (e.g., Traditional VUL in USD, Self-Directed VUL in TWD) across different markets without geographic restrictions
- Current systems limit premium calculations to USD, preventing global expansion and flexible product positioning
- Policy currency must remain immutable post-creation while supporting investment options in different currencies to balance operational stability with customer flexibility
features.key_capabilities:
**Quote Initialization with Currency Selection**
User initiates quote creation and selects state and currency; system filters available products based on currency-package relationships and applies currency context to all monetary defaults.

**Product Configuration and Filtering**
System dynamically presents products configured for the selected currency; currency-package relationships determine product availability ensuring only compatible offerings are displayed.

**Premium Calculation Processing**
System executes multi-currency rating calculations across UI, Policy Backend, and OpenL layers using selected currency as dimension for accurate premium determination.

**Currency-Aware Data Management**
Upon quote creation, system locks currency selection and maintains currency context throughout policy lifecycle; all money-type attributes display values with appropriate currency symbols matching field specifications rather than global locale defaults.
features.acceptance_criteria:
**Currency Selection and Product Availability**
Given product-currency relationships are configured, When user selects a currency, Then system displays only products/packages configured for that currency and applies currency to all monetary defaults.

**Premium Calculation Accuracy**
Given currency is selected during quote initialization, When system calculates premium, Then calculations execute using selected currency across all system layers (UI, Policy Backend, OpenL) with correct currency symbols displayed.

**Currency Immutability**
Given a quote is created with selected currency, When user attempts modifications, Then system prevents currency changes while allowing investment fund selections in different currencies.

**Configuration Prerequisite Validation**
Given multi-currency support is requested, When product configuration is incomplete (currencyCd not marked as Dimension/OfferContext or OpenL mapping missing), Then system prevents multi-currency quote creation.

features.business_context:

- **Investment Flexibility**: Separate policy currency from investment fund currencies for investment-linked products, allowing broader portfolio options
- **Current Limitation**: Manual currency handling creates operational inefficiencies and limits product availability based on system locale rather than customer preference
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Quote Initiation with Currency Selection**
User initiates quote creation and selects desired transaction currency during product specification phase. System captures currency preference as foundational quote attribute.

**2. Dynamic Product Filtering**
Upon currency selection, system applies business rules to filter available product packages based on currency-product relationships, ensuring only compatible offerings are presented.

**3. Currency-Specific Premium Calculation**
System passes currency code to rating engine, which executes currency-specific calculation rules and returns premiums denominated in selected currency with appropriate monetary formatting.

features.acceptance_criteria:

Given a user selects USD currency, When system filters products, Then Variable Universal Life, Whole Life, and Universal Life packages are available; Given TWD selection, Then only Variable Universal Life package is presented.

Given currency is selected during quote initiation, When rating engine calculates premiums, Then all monetary values reflect selected currency with proper symbols and calculation rules specific to that currency.

**3. Currency Immutability Post-Creation**
Given a quote exists with assigned currency, When user attempts currency modification, Then system prevents change and maintains original currency throughout policy lifecycle.

**4. Investment Currency Independence**
Given an investment-linked product with policy currency TWD, When customer selects investment funds, Then funds denominated in other currencies remain available for selection.

features.evidence: Applicability decision table for entity manager listener configuration: Entity Manager Listener [multiple JIRA references for quote init, offer, validate, refresh, cancel, decline, reinstate, rescind, rewrite operations]
features.process_name: Execute Entity Lifecycle Event Listeners Across Policy Transactions
features.action: orchestrate automated lifecycle event processing across policy operations through configurable listener framework
features.value: policy transactions execute consistently with appropriate business rules, validations, and cross-functional controls applied automatically based on operation type
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **orchestrate automated lifecycle event processing across policy operations through configurable listener framework**,
So that **policy transactions execute consistently with appropriate business rules, validations, and cross-functional controls applied automatically based on operation type**
features.business_context:
- **Strategic Value**: Centralized configuration-driven framework ensures consistent application of business rules across all policy lifecycle operations without requiring code changes for rule modifications
- **Current Pain Point**: Manual intervention or inconsistent rule application across different policy operations leads to errors, compliance gaps, and operational inefficiencies
- **Business Imperative**: Support multiple product lines (individual and group) with complex producer management, compensation validation, and organizational hierarchy controls
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Configuration Loading and Rule Determination**
System loads listener configuration rules from decision table and determines applicable listeners based on policy operation type and business context

**2. Operation-Specific Event Routing**
Upon transaction initiation, system routes to appropriate business process (Quote Init, Offer, Cancellation, Decline, Reinstatement, Rescind, Rewrite, Validation, Refresh, Reset, Default Apply)
    2.1 When quote operations occur, listener applies initial creation and validation rules
    2.2 When policy modifications occur, listener enforces change-specific business constraints

**3. Cross-Functional Control Execution**
System applies Book of Business filtering, Independent Commissionable Producer management rules, and compensation contract validation for group products

**4. Business Rule Application and Validation**
System executes operation-specific business logic, validations, and data transformations according to configured rules
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Configuration-Driven Listener Activation**
Given a policy operation is initiated, When the system evaluates the decision table configuration, Then the appropriate listeners are triggered based on operation type and business context

**2. Operation-Specific Processing**
Given a specific policy operation type (Quote, Offer, Cancellation, etc.), When the listener routes the transaction, Then the corresponding business process executes with operation-specific rules and validations applied

**3. Cross-Functional Control Enforcement**
Given producer assignment or group product transactions, When cross-functional controls are required, Then Book of Business filtering, ICP management, and compensation validation rules are enforced successfully

**4. Business Rule Consistency**
Given multiple policy transactions of the same type, When listeners process each transaction, Then identical business rules and validations are applied consistently across all instances

features.feature: Retry Cascading Process for Individual Member Records
features.source_document: GRC_Policy/Policy/Policy Processes and Capabilities/Policy Group Insurance Capabilities/Group Benefits Common Capabilities/Manage Cascading Process/UC_Use Case Diagram for Cascading process/UC_Retry Cascading Process for particular Member Quote_Record.md
features.evidence: This Use case describes retrying of the Cascading Process for particular Member Quote/Record. Retry action will cascade only one missed or failed transaction from Master Policy per each calling of Retry.
features.process_name: Retry Cascading Process for Individual Member Records
features.action: retry failed data cascading from master policy to member records
features.value: master policy changes are successfully propagated to affected member policies without manual data reconciliation
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **retry failed data cascading from master policy to member records**,
So that **master policy changes are successfully propagated to affected member policies without manual data reconciliation**
features.business_context:
- Ensures data consistency across master-member policy hierarchies when automated synchronization failures occur
- Reduces manual intervention and operational overhead from cascading process failures
- Supports recovery from transient system errors or data conflicts during policy replication workflows
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Transaction Identification & Validation**
User is able to initiate retry for a specific member quote or record. System validates request authorization and locates all revisions with failed or missing cascading flags from the master policy source.

**2. Failed Flag Cleanup**
Upon identifying failed transactions, system removes all failed cascading indicators across all revisions of the target member quote or record to prepare for retry execution.

**3. Cascading Re-execution**
System propagates master policy data changes to the identified member quote or record using the original cascading logic.
    3.1 If target is member record with quote created during prior failed attempt, system removes the failed quote revision before retry
    3.2 When cascading completes, system triggers monitoring event for the retry process

**4. Failure Recovery Path**
If retry fails again, system flags the transaction requiring manual resolution of policy data conflicts before resubmission.
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Successful Single Transaction Retry**
Given a member record has one failed cascading transaction, When administrator initiates retry process, Then system propagates master policy changes to that specific transaction only and marks cascading as successful.

**2. No Eligible Transactions Found**
Given a member record has no failed or missing cascading flags, When retry is invoked, Then system exits without processing and returns appropriate status.

**3. Member Record with Failed Quote Cleanup**
Given a member record contains a quote created during previous failed cascading, When retry is initiated, Then system removes the failed quote revision before re-executing cascading logic.

**4. Persistent Failure Handling**
Given retry cascading fails again due to unresolved conflicts, When system completes retry attempt, Then transaction remains flagged as failed requiring manual intervention.

**5. Multiple Failed Transactions**
Given a member record has multiple failed cascading transactions, When single retry is executed, Then system processes exactly one transaction and requires additional retry invocations for remaining failures.

features.source_document: GRC_Policy/Policy/Policy Processes and Capabilities/Policy Group Insurance Capabilities/Group Benefits Common Capabilities/Manage Cascading Process/UC_Use Case Diagram for Cascading process/UC_Retry Cascading Process for a Master Policy.md

features.process_name: Master Policy Cascading Retry and Repair
features.action: retry or repair cascading failures for master policy member records
features.value: master policy changes propagate successfully to all member policies, reducing manual intervention and system downtime
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **retry or repair cascading failures for master policy member records**,
So that **master policy changes propagate successfully to all member policies, reducing manual intervention and system downtime**
features.business_context:
- **Strategic Value**: Ensures master policy amendments/renewals automatically cascade to member records without data loss, maintaining policy hierarchy integrity
- **Current Pain Point**: System timeouts or data conflicts cause cascading failures across multiple member records, requiring administrative intervention
- **Business Impact**: Failed cascading blocks enrollment processes and leaves member policies out of sync with master policy terms
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Cascading Eligibility Validation**
System validates master policy revision supports cascading and identifies affected member quotes and records for processing

**2. Normal Retry Mode Execution**
System removes failed cascading flags from member records and re-executes cascading propagation for each member quote or policy
    2.1 Upon detection of member record, system removes orphaned quote revisions created by previous failed cascading
    2.2 When cascading succeeds, system logs completion event and proceeds to next member record

**3. Repair Mode Activation**
When force suspension flag is enabled for amendment or renewal transactions, system removes failed transaction artifacts and suspends affected member records for next cascading cycle
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Successful Normal Retry Completion**
Given multiple member records with cascading failures, When retry process executes without force suspension, Then system propagates master policy changes to all eligible member records and logs success events

**2. Repair Mode Suspension Handling**
Given force suspension flag is TRUE for amendment transaction, When repair mode executes, Then system suspends affected member records and removes failed cascading artifacts without executing cascading logic

**3. Transaction Type Validation**
Given force suspension flag is TRUE for non-amendment transaction type, When system validates repair mode eligibility, Then system prevents execution and returns transaction type error

**4. Partial Failure Resilience**
Given cascading fails for subset of member records, When retry continues processing remaining records, Then successfully processed records reflect master policy changes while failed records retain error flags

features.description:

features.feature: Track Cascading Process Status and Flags
features.source_document: GRC_Policy/Policy/Policy Processes and Capabilities/Policy Group Insurance Capabilities/Group Benefits Common Capabilities/Manage Cascading Process/TXT_Cascading Process status.md
features.evidence: PolicyCascadingProcessingFlag identifies the attribute in the Individual model which is responsible to keep a link to the related Master policy or quote... Flag examples are Cancel Notice, Do Not Renew, or OOS Processing.
features.process_name: Track Cascading Process Status and Flags
features.action: monitor and control automated propagation of Master Policy changes to linked Individual Policies/Quotes through cascading status lifecycle management
features.value: Master Policy operations consistently apply to subordinate entities with full visibility into processing states, manual intervention points, and failure recovery
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **monitor and control automated propagation of Master Policy changes to linked Individual Policies/Quotes through cascading status lifecycle management**,
So that **Master Policy operations consistently apply to subordinate entities with full visibility into processing states, manual intervention points, and failure recovery**
features.business_context:
- **Strategic Value**: Ensures hierarchical policy structures maintain operational integrity when Master Policy changes (Amendments, Cancellations, Renewals) must propagate to Individual Policies/Quotes without manual duplication
- **Current Pain Point**: Manual tracking of cascading operations creates risk of incomplete propagation, with no visibility into which subordinate policies processed successfully or failed
- **Operational Need**: Support both automated and manual cascading workflows while isolating exceptions (ported members, non-applicable changes) and providing retry capability for failed operations
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Cascading Initiation and Eligibility Assessment**
When Master Policy operation triggers (Amendment, Cancellation, Rewrite, Issue, Reinstate, Rescind, Renewal), system evaluates linked Individual Policies/Quotes for eligibility and sets initial CASCADING_INITIATED status.
    1.1 If entity ineligible, status transitions to NOT_AFFECTED and no processing occurs.

**2. Active Cascading Execution**
Upon eligibility confirmation, status advances to IN_PROGRESS and system applies Master Policy changes to Individual entities.

**3. Manual Intervention Handling**
If product configuration requires manual cascading, status transitions to MANUAL and awaits user completion before advancing to COMPLETED.

**4. Exception and Suspension Management**
When entity is ported member or change has no effect, status transitions to SUSPENDED and processing halts without state change.

**5. Completion and Failure Resolution**
Upon successful processing, status transitions to COMPLETED with entity state updated. If errors occur, status transitions to FAILED enabling retry operations.

**6. Status Persistence and Visibility**
System stores current status only (no history) in Policy Flag Storage with UI mapping for operational monitoring.
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Successful Automated Cascading**
Given Master Policy triggers cancellation with eligible Individual Policies, When cascading executes without errors, Then all Individual Policy statuses transition CASCADING_INITIATED  IN_PROGRESS  COMPLETED and entity states reflect cancellation.

**2. Manual Intervention Workflow**
Given product configured for manual cascading, When cascading reaches manual step, Then status transitions to MANUAL, system blocks single manual flag per policy, and completion transitions status to COMPLETED.

**3. Eligibility Exclusion Handling**
Given Individual Quote ineligible for Master Amendment, When eligibility assessment occurs, Then status immediately transitions to NOT_AFFECTED and no entity state change occurs.

**4. Exception Suspension Processing**
Given ported member record during renewal cascading, When system detects ported status, Then status transitions to SUSPENDED and member record remains unchanged.

**5. Failure Recovery Mechanism**
Given cascading operation fails during IN_PROGRESS, When error detected, Then status transitions to FAILED and retry operation returns status to initial state or completes successfully.

**6. Single Status Storage Enforcement**
Given any status transition, When system persists cascading status, Then only last status value stored without change history in Policy Flag Storage.

features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **orchestrate lifecycle transactions from master policies to member policies and quotes through automated cascading logic**,
So that **member policy states remain synchronized with master policy changes, reducing manual coordination and ensuring consistent policy management across the group hierarchy**
features.business_context:
- **Strategic Value**: Enables automated propagation of master policy lifecycle events (cancellation, amendment, renewal, reinstatement) to all linked individual policies and quotes, maintaining hierarchical data integrity without manual intervention
- **Current Pain Point**: Manual tracking of cascading impacts from master policy changes risks data inconsistency and operational delays across member entities
- **Compliance Need**: Ensures synchronized state management between master and member policies per regulatory and business rule requirements
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Master Policy Event Evaluation**
System evaluates master policy or quote lifecycle events (cancellation, amendment, rewrite, issuance, reinstatement, renewal, BOR transfer) and determines linked member entities requiring cascading updates.

**2. Conditional Cascading Execution**
Upon event identification, system executes cascading logic based on transaction type and linked entity (individual policy vs. quote), triggering appropriate sub-processes (cancel, amend, rewrite, reinstate, renew, transfer).

**3. State Transition Management**
System propagates changes to member entities, transitioning individual policies to target states (issued, cancelled) and individual quotes to appropriate workflow states (dataGather, companyDeclined, issued).

**4. Premium Recalculation and Issuance**
When amendments or renewals cascade, system recalculates premiums for affected individual quotes and issues updated policy documents where required.

**5. Relationship Preservation**
System maintains hierarchical linkage between master and member entities throughout all cascading transactions, ensuring traceability and audit compliance.
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Master Policy Cancellation Cascade**
Given a master policy cancellation event, When linked individual policies exist, Then system cascades cancellation and transitions individual policies to cancelled state; individual quotes transition to companyDeclined state.

**2. Master Amendment Propagation**
Given a master amendment quote issuance with txType Amendment or NBPA, When linked member entities exist, Then system cascades amendment to individual policies (resulting in issued state) and individual quotes (resulting in dataGather state) with premium recalculation.

**3. Master Policy Reinstatement Synchronization**
Given a master policy reinstatement, When linked individual policies exist, Then system cascades reinstatement to individual policies (resulting in issued state) and individual quotes (resulting in dataGather state).

**4. BOR Transfer State Preservation**
Given a master policy BOR transfer, When linked individual quotes exist, Then system executes cascading transfer while preserving individual quote's pre-existing workflow state (initiated, dataGather, or premiumCalculated).

**5. Hierarchical Integrity Validation**
Given any cascading transaction completion, When system validates entity relationships, Then master-to-member linkage remains intact with full audit trail of propagated changes.

features.value: organizational changes are executed without disrupting coverage, premium obligations, or customer service commitments
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **transfer ownership of policies and quotes between agents or agencies while preserving business continuity**,
So that **organizational changes are executed without disrupting coverage, premium obligations, or customer service commitments**
features.business_context:
- **Strategic Value**: Enables business restructuring scenarios including producer retirement, agency acquisitions, business sales, and data correction without policy re-underwriting or customer impact
- **Current Pain Point**: Manual broker transfers risk premium recalculation errors, coverage gaps during transition, and loss of historical relationship data
- **Operational Impact**: Supports bulk portfolio migrations and future-dated transitions aligned to renewal cycles, maintaining data segregation and agent visibility boundaries
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Initiate Broker Transfer**
User submits single or bulk transfer request to reassign policy/quote ownership between agents or agencies

**2. Validate Transfer Eligibility**
System confirms policy active status on transfer date and removes pending quotes that conflict with transfer timing

**3. Execute Ownership Change**
System creates new policy version with updated agency assignments as non-rate bearing transaction, preserving premium and coverage terms
    3.1 Upon future-dated request, system schedules execution for specified date or next renewal
    3.2 When bulk transfer requested, system processes multiple policies simultaneously

**4. Restore Business State**
System restores quote workflows to pre-transfer status following defined progression sequence
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Eligible Policy Transfer**
Given active policy within term, When transfer submitted with valid target agent, Then system creates new version with updated ownership without premium recalculation

**2. Ineligible Policy Rejection**
Given cancelled or expired policy, When transfer attempted, Then system prevents execution and notifies user of eligibility violation

**3. Pending Quote Handling**
Given policy with pending quotes, When transfer initiated, Then system removes quotes before executing transfer

**4. Future-Dated Execution**
Given valid future transfer date, When scheduled transfer configured, Then system queues execution for specified date or renewal event

**5. Bulk Transfer Processing**
Given multiple eligible policies, When bulk transfer submitted, Then system completes all transfers maintaining individual validation rules

features.source_document: GRC_Policy/Policy/Policy Processes and Capabilities/Policy Common Capabilities/BOR Transfer.md

features.process_name: Execute Bulk Book of Business Transfer Operations
features.action: transfer agency and producer ownership across multiple policies in a single bulk operation
features.value: efficiently manage portfolio changes resulting from business events like agency acquisitions, producer retirements, or organizational restructuring while maintaining data integrity and business continuity
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **transfer agency and producer ownership across multiple policies in a single bulk operation**,
So that **efficiently manage portfolio changes resulting from business events like agency acquisitions, producer retirements, or organizational restructuring while maintaining data integrity and business continuity**
features.business_context:
- Supports critical business events including producer retirement, agency acquisition, business sale, agency absorption, and insured-requested changes without disrupting coverage
- Eliminates manual processing inefficiencies by enabling simultaneous ownership transfers across entire policy portfolios while preserving policy terms and premium calculations
- Maintains Book of Business data segregation integrity ensuring agents access only authorized customer, policy, billing, and claims data within their organizational hierarchy
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Bulk Transfer Initiation**
User initiates bulk agency transfer operation on multiple eligible policies simultaneously, selecting target policies based on current agency/producer ownership criteria

**2. Eligibility Validation & Authorization**
System validates user privileges for bulk transfer and policy update operations, then confirms policy eligibility by verifying non-cancelled/non-expired status, absence of pending transactions, and effective date alignment with policy terms

**3. Ownership Assignment & Processing**
User provides new agency/producer information and effective date; system validates changes differ from current ownership and processes transfers as non-rate bearing changes without premium recalculation

**4. Scheduled Transfer Execution**
When future-dated transfer is required, user schedules execution for specific date or renewal cycle; system stores pending change instructions and automatically executes at designated time

**5. Portfolio Data Segregation Update**
Upon successful transfer completion, system updates Book of Business access controls to reflect new agency ownership hierarchy and logs all transactions for audit compliance
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Authorized Bulk Transfer Processing**
Given user possesses bulk transfer and policy update privileges, when multiple eligible policies are selected for ownership transfer, then system processes all transfers simultaneously with consistent validation logic

**2. Eligibility Enforcement**
Given policies exist in various statuses, when bulk transfer is initiated, then system rejects cancelled/expired policies and those with pending transactions while proceeding with eligible items

**3. Non-Rate Bearing Change Execution**
Given new agency/producer information differs from current ownership, when transfer executes, then system creates new policy versions without recalculating premiums or rates

**4. Scheduled Transfer Activation**
Given pending transfer is scheduled for future date, when execution date arrives or renewal triggers, then system automatically applies ownership changes and updates Book of Business segregation

**5. Data Integrity Protection**
Given transfer attempts to assign existing ownership values, when system detects no actual change, then operation is rejected preventing duplicate transactions

features.process_name: Book of Business Transfer on Policy Renewal
features.action: execute broker of record transfer during policy renewal
features.value: I can seamlessly reassign policy ownership to new agents or agencies while maintaining business continuity and data integrity
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **execute broker of record transfer during policy renewal**,
So that **I can seamlessly reassign policy ownership to new agents or agencies while maintaining business continuity and data integrity**
features.business_context:
- **Strategic Value**: Supports producer retirement transitions, agency mergers/acquisitions, insured-requested changes, and data corrections while preserving policy continuity
- **Current Pain Points**: Manual transfer processes risk data inconsistency; pending quotes block transfers; future-dated transfers require administrative overhead
- **Business Impact**: Enables flexible book of business management across agent-to-agent, agent-to-agency, and agency-to-agency scenarios without rate recalculation
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Transfer Eligibility Verification**
User validates policy is non-cancelled, non-expired, and eligible for transfer; system checks for pending quotes or roll-on transactions that would block execution

**2. Transfer Scope Selection**
User selects transfer type (agent-to-agent, agent-to-external-agent, or agency-to-agency) and implementation approach (single policy or bulk transfer across multiple policies)

**3. Future-Dated Transfer Scheduling**
When user specifies renewal execution, system creates pending change flag with effective date and premium split information; transfer executes automatically upon renewal trigger
    3.1 User can cancel pending transfers before execution via removal command

**4. Transfer Execution & Policy Version Creation**
System processes transfer command, creates new policy version with updated agency information without recalculating rates/premiums, and logs transaction history

**5. Quote Restoration Handling**
Upon detecting pending quotes, system removes quotes before transfer, then restores them to pre-transfer status through automated status sequencing post-transfer

**6. Agency Data Synchronization**
System updates agency details across all policy components and returns policy summary with synchronized producer information via configured transformation
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Eligible Policy Transfer**
Given a non-cancelled, non-expired policy with no pending roll-on transactions, When user initiates BOR transfer with valid target agent/agency, Then system creates new policy version with updated producer information without rate recalculation

**2. Future-Dated Renewal Transfer**
Given a valid transfer request with renewal execution flag, When user schedules transfer for next renewal, Then system creates pending change record and executes transfer automatically at renewal effective date

**3. Pending Quote Blocking**
Given a policy with active pending quotes, When user attempts BOR transfer, Then system prevents transfer execution until quotes are removed and initiates quote restoration post-transfer

**4. Invalid Effective Date Prevention**
Given a transfer request with effective date outside policy term boundaries, When system validates transaction date, Then system prevents submission and requires date adjustment within current term

**5. Insufficient Privilege Protection**
Given a user lacking required BOR transfer and policy update privileges, When transfer is attempted, Then system denies access and requires administrator privilege assignment

**6. No-Change Detection**
Given transfer details identical to current producer information, When system validates data changes, Then system prevents unnecessary transaction and notifies user of no-change condition

As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **transfer policies and quotes between agencies or brokers outside the standard renewal cycle**,
So that **business continuity is maintained during agent transitions, agency reorganizations, and broker changes without impacting policy coverage or premium calculations**
features.business_context:
- Supports critical business events including agent retirement, agency acquisitions, insured-requested broker changes, and data corrections requiring ownership reassignment
- Eliminates manual workarounds and policy rewrites previously needed for mid-term broker changes, reducing operational costs and errors

features.key_capabilities:
**Transfer Initiation & Validation**
User initiates broker change for active policies or quotes. System validates user authorization, policy eligibility (non-cancelled, non-expired), and target agency existence.

features.process_name: Select Policies for Automated Job Processing
features.action: define and manage policy selection for batch processing jobs
features.value: only eligible policies meeting both predefined lists and dynamic criteria are processed, ensuring accurate and controlled batch operations
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **define and manage policy selection for batch processing jobs**,
So that **only eligible policies meeting both predefined lists and dynamic criteria are processed, ensuring accurate and controlled batch operations**.
features.business_context:
- Enables precise control over which policies enter automated workflows (e.g., renewals, transfers, bulk updates) by combining manual curation with rule-based filtering
- Reduces processing errors and system load by preventing ineligible policies from entering batch jobs
- Supports compliance and audit requirements by maintaining transparent policy selection logic across all lines of business
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Policy List Preparation**
Administrator preloads target policies into a processing queue for upcoming batch job execution.

**2. Selection Criteria Definition**
Administrator establishes dynamic filtering rules based on business requirements for policy eligibility.

**3. Intersection Processing**
System computes final processing set by identifying policies present in both the predefined list and criteria match results.
    3.1 When predefined list is empty, system relies solely on criteria-based selection.
    3.2 When both sources exist, system enforces dual validation through intersection logic.

**4. Job Execution Initiation**
System processes only the validated policy set, ensuring controlled and predictable batch operations.
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Dual-Source Selection**
Given both predefined list and selection criteria are configured, When job execution starts, Then system processes only policies present in both sources.

**2. Criteria-Only Fallback**
Given predefined list is empty, When selection criteria are defined, Then system processes all policies matching criteria without list constraints.

**3. Cross-LOB Consistency**
Given policies from multiple lines of business, When selection logic is applied, Then intersection rules apply uniformly across all product types.

**4. Processing Set Validation**
Given final policy set is determined, When job initiates, Then system prevents processing of policies absent from the intersection result.

features.process_name: Execute Automated Aging Processes for Group Policies
features.action: automate age-based policy lifecycle transactions triggered by insured persons reaching critical age thresholds
features.value: policies remain compliant with age-related eligibility rules and coverage terms are adjusted or terminated automatically without manual intervention
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **automate age-based policy lifecycle transactions triggered by insured persons reaching critical age thresholds**,
So that **policies remain compliant with age-related eligibility rules and coverage terms are adjusted or terminated automatically without manual intervention**.
features.business_context:
- Reduces administrative burden by eliminating manual monitoring of insured persons' ages against policy termination and eligibility thresholds
- Ensures regulatory compliance and contractual accuracy by systematically applying age-based rules at policy anniversaries
- Prevents coverage gaps or unauthorized extensions by proactively executing cancellations or amendments when insureds exceed allowable age limits
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Aging Event Initiation**
Upon policy anniversary, system evaluates all insured persons (Primary, Spouse, Child) against their respective age thresholds and calculates attained ages.

**2. Transaction Prioritization Logic**
When Primary Insured exceeds termination age, system prioritizes Cancellation transaction. When Spouse or Child exceeds limits, system triggers Amendment transaction.
    2.1 If age band range is exceeded but termination age not reached, system executes Amendment
    2.2 If no thresholds breached, system logs No Change outcome

**3. Effective Date Determination**
System calculates aging effective date based on master anniversary date and aging flag data, ensuring accurate transaction timing.

**4. Transaction Execution**
System automatically processes the determined transaction type (Cancellation/Amendment/No Change) without manual review.
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Primary Insured Termination**
Given Primary Insured attained age exceeds policy termination age, When aging process executes, Then system initiates Cancellation transaction effective on anniversary date.

**2. Dependent Age Limit Breach**
Given Spouse or Child attained age exceeds their termination threshold, When aging evaluation occurs, Then system triggers Amendment transaction to adjust coverage.

**3. Age Band Transition**
Given insured age exits current age band range but remains below termination age, When system calculates attained age, Then Amendment transaction updates policy rating parameters.

**4. No Change Scenario**
Given all insured persons remain within valid age bands and below termination ages, When aging process completes, Then system records No Change status without policy modification.

features.description:

- Eliminates manual tracking errors and reduces administrative overhead when managing age-dependent coverage changes
- Supports accurate premium calculations and timely benefit adjustments aligned with contractual anniversary dates
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Birthday Milestone Identification**
System identifies the earliest upcoming birthday among all covered persons on the policy to establish potential aging trigger dates.

**2. Anniversary Date Reconciliation**
System recalculates policy and member anniversary dates with correct year adjustments to ensure alignment with current coverage period.

**2. Anniversary Date Accuracy**

**3. Aging Frequency Logic Application**

**4. Termination Provision Handling**

features.description:
As a Policy Administrator,
I want to process age-based policy amendments automatically,
So that insureds are removed or adjusted when reaching age thresholds without manual intervention, maintaining data integrity and compliance
features.business_context:
- **Strategic Value**: Automates age-related eligibility changes (dependent aging out, spouse termination) to reduce administrative burden and ensure timely compliance with benefit plan rules.
- **Current Pain Points**: Manual tracking of dependent ages is error-prone; delayed removals create billing discrepancies and regulatory exposure.
- **Business Impact**: Prevents overpayment for ineligible dependents, maintains accurate coverage records, and supports seamless tier adjustments (e.g., Family to Employee+Spouse).
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Age Verification Trigger**
System calculates attained age for all policy participants (primary, spouse, dependents) against defined termination thresholds at specified intervals.

**2. Eligibility Assessment**
System evaluates termination criteria by person type, applying product-specific age rules and determining effective termination dates (immediate or first-of-month).

**3. Coverage Adjustment Execution**
System removes aged-out insureds from coverages, adjusts tier structures, and cascades changes when dependencies exist between coverages.

**4. Data Integrity Reconciliation**
System removes person records only when no associations remain, preventing orphaned data while maintaining referential integrity across insureds and beneficiaries.
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Age Threshold Detection**
Given a policy with dependents approaching age limits, when the aging evaluation runs, then all participants exceeding thresholds are identified for termination.

features.evidence: Term duration for quotes/policies is defined always in days. Duration of the term type is set based on the 'noOfMonthsInTerm' attribute. Value of the 'noOfMonthsInTerm' attribute defines duration of a term in months
features.process_name: Policy Term Duration and Date Calculation System
features.action: configure policy term durations and manage effective/expiration dates across the policy lifecycle
features.value: policy terms align with business rules and regulatory requirements while maintaining consistency across transactions
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **configure policy term durations and manage effective/expiration dates across the policy lifecycle**,
So that **policy terms align with business rules and regulatory requirements while maintaining consistency across transactions**.
features.business_context:
- Ensures accurate policy term management across New Business, Endorsement, and Renewal transactions for Home and Auto insurance products
- Eliminates manual calculation errors by automating date determinations based on term type and inception date alignment
- Supports flexible term structures (Regular, Custom, Perpetual) to accommodate diverse business and regulatory requirements
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Term Type Configuration**
System determines term duration using term code lookup (noOfMonthsInTerm attribute). Regular Terms use fixed monthly durations; Custom Terms allow flexible durations including perpetual policies without expiration dates.

**2. New Business Date Management**
User establishes effective date (defaulted to current date) and system calculates expiration based on term type. For Regular Terms, calculation uses month addition with includeLastDay parameter. Custom Terms require manual expiration entry.

**3. Endorsement Date Enforcement**
System locks effective and expiration dates inherited from original policy term, preventing modifications during endorsement transactions.

**4. Renewal Date Automation**
System auto-determines renewal effective date from prior expiration (adjusted by includeLastDay flag) and recalculates expiration date. Expiration aligns with inception date day-of-month when feasible, handling edge cases like February 29 or month-end dates.

**5. Term Type Conversion**
User modifies term type during renewal. Upon switching to Custom Term, inception date resets and manual expiration entry is required. Switching between Regular Terms triggers automatic expiration recalculation.
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. New Business Term Establishment**
Given a new policy is initiated, When user selects Regular Term type, Then system calculates expiration date by adding term months to effective date adjusted by includeLastDay configuration.

**2. Endorsement Date Immutability**
Given an active policy undergoes endorsement, When user attempts to modify term dates, Then system prevents changes and retains original effective/expiration dates.

**3. Renewal Date Alignment**
Given a policy renews with Regular Term, When system calculates renewal dates, Then effective date equals prior expiration (adjusted by includeLastDay) and expiration date aligns with inception date day-of-month.

**4. Custom Term Flexibility**
Given user selects Custom Term type, When establishing term dates, Then system allows manual expiration date entry and supports perpetual policies without expiration dates.

**5. Term Type Conversion Handling**
Given renewal transaction changes term type, When switching from Regular to Custom Term, Then system resets inception date and requires manual expiration entry.

**3. Failed Issuance Recovery**
Given a purchase pending quote, When issuance fails, Then system transitions to issueFailed state and prevents policy creation until resolved.

**4. Policy Modification Processing**
Given an issued policy, When user initiates endorsement/renewal, Then system creates new version in dataGather state and maintains original until completion.

**5. Version & Archive Management**
Given any active quote/policy, When user creates version or archives, Then system preserves original state and enables restoration from archive.

**6. Lifecycle State Restrictions**
Given a quote/policy in terminal state (expired/declined/cancelled), When user attempts invalid transition, Then system prevents action and maintains state integrity.

features.value: the system automatically validates coverage parameters within allowable ranges, ensuring regulatory compliance, preventing underwriting errors, and maintaining product integrity across policy lifecycle operations
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **configure and enforce minimum and maximum constraints on coverage attributes for Commercial Fleet Auto policies based on policy year and product rules**,
So that **the system automatically validates coverage parameters within allowable ranges, ensuring regulatory compliance, preventing underwriting errors, and maintaining product integrity across policy lifecycle operations**
features.business_context:
- Commercial Fleet Auto products require strict control over coverage deductibles, limits, and endorsement parameters to meet regulatory requirements and manage risk exposure
- Different policy years (2017 vs 2018+) have distinct product configurations and coverage offerings requiring year-specific constraint rules
- Manual validation of coverage ranges is error-prone and inefficient across quote, bind, endorsement, and renewal operations
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Policy Year-Based Configuration Selection**
Upon policy transaction initiation, system identifies policy effective year and loads corresponding decision table ruleset (2017 configuration or 2018+ configuration).

**2. Coverage Attribute Constraint Validation**
System evaluates coverage deductibles, limits, and endorsement parameters against configured minimum-maximum ranges during default apply, offer, refresh, and validate operations.

**3. Product Evolution Management**
When product definitions change, system applies version-specific constraints, excluding deprecated coverages and incorporating new endorsement controls across policy lifecycle endpoints.
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Year-Specific Rule Application**
Given a policy with 2017 effective date, When coverage validation executes, Then system applies 2017 decision table constraints.

**2. Constraint Enforcement**
Given coverage attributes submitted, When values fall outside configured min-max ranges, Then system prevents transaction completion and identifies non-compliant attributes.

**3. Deprecated Coverage Handling**
Given Version 4 configuration active, When policy includes removed coverage types (AutoCSLCoverage, AutoPDCoverage, AutoUMPDCoverage, AutoUMBICoverage, AutoUMCSLCoverage, AutoBICoverage), Then system excludes constraint validation for those coverages.

**4. Multi-Endpoint Consistency**
Given constraint rules configured, When applied across default, offer, refresh, and validate endpoints, Then system enforces identical min-max ranges consistently.

features.process_name: Master Policy Data Replication to Member Quotes
features.action: replicate master policy configuration to individual member quotes automatically
features.value: member quotes inherit accurate policy terms without manual data entry, reducing errors and setup time
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **replicate master policy configuration to individual member quotes automatically**,
So that **member quotes inherit accurate policy terms without manual data entry, reducing errors and setup time**
features.business_context:
- **Strategic Value**: Ensures consistency between group master policies and individual member coverage while accelerating quote generation for group insurance products.
- **Pain Point**: Manual data entry across master policies and member quotes creates inconsistencies, delays enrollment, and increases administrative overhead.
- **Business Need**: Automated synchronization of policy structure, benefit packages, plans, and coverage attributes maintains data integrity across the policy hierarchy.
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Master Policy Validation & Retrieval**
System validates master policy existence and business rules before initiating replication.

**2. Policy-Level Attribute Replication**
System replicates policy-level configuration and compensation data using configured strategies (Default, Reset, Ignore).

**3. Package & Plan Structure Synchronization**
Upon package code and plan name identification, system locates matching structures in master policy and replicates to member quote.

**4. Coverage & Benefit Data Propagation**
System replicates coverage attributes and benefit structures based on member quote's defined coverage types (Core, BU, or both).

**5. Eligibility Configuration Transfer**
System retrieves and applies eligibility attributes from master policy to member quote entities.

**6. Conditional Replication Execution**
When package/plan details are absent, system completes policy-level replication only without deeper structure synchronization.
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Successful Full Replication**
Given master policy exists and member quote has package code and plan name, when replication executes, then system returns complete quote with policy attributes, package structure, coverage data, and eligibility rules replicated per mapping configuration.

**2. Validation Failure Handling**
Given master policy link is invalid or business rules fail, when replication initiates, then system halts process and returns error response without partial data changes.

**3. Partial Replication Scenario**
Given member quote lacks package code or plan name, when replication executes, then system completes policy-level and compensation data transfer only, excluding package and coverage structures.

**4. Coverage Structure Alignment**
Given master policy contains single coverage type, when member quote has multiple coverage types defined, then system removes incompatible coverage and replicates matching structure only.

**5. Data Integrity Assurance**
Given successful replication completion, when system returns response, then HTTP 200 status confirms all configured mapping rules and applicability conditions were satisfied.

Administrator establishes classification dimensions (employment status, pay type, work location) that will differentiate employee groups for eligibility purposes.

features.key_capabilities:
**1. Input Validation & Employee Status Determination**
Upon receiving request parameters, system validates completeness and determines employee status by comparing original hire date against master policy effective date to classify as new or existing employee.

System resolves classification group links to identify applicable classification rules matching class identifier, then filters rules where all parameter criteria are satisfied including wildcard 'Any' values.

System resolves plan names from matched rules, selects eligibility attributes matching target plan, and filters by employee status using appropriate postfix identifiers to retrieve final attribute set.

features.acceptance_criteria:

Given missing or null required parameters, when system validates input, then empty response is returned without further processing.

Given no classification rules match or classification groups are absent, when system cannot resolve via rules, then attributes are retrieved from coverage-level business entities based on employee status.

features.process_name: Process Out-of-Sequence Amendments with Roll-On Logic
features.action: configure and enable out-of-sequence policy amendments with automated roll-on reconciliation
features.value: policy changes can be processed non-sequentially while maintaining data integrity across master and individual policies through automated synchronization
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **configure and enable out-of-sequence policy amendments with automated roll-on reconciliation**,
So that **policy changes can be processed non-sequentially while maintaining data integrity across master and individual policies through automated synchronization**
features.business_context:
- **Strategic Value**: Enables flexible policy amendment processing that accommodates real-world business scenarios where changes occur out of chronological order, reducing administrative overhead and improving customer service responsiveness
- **Current Pain Point**: Sequential-only amendment processing creates bottlenecks when earlier effective dates must be processed after later changes, requiring manual reconciliation
- **Business Impact**: Automated roll-on logic ensures downstream policies remain synchronized with master policy changes, eliminating data inconsistencies and reducing compliance risk
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Business Validation & Enablement**
Verify out-of-sequence amendment eligibility from business perspective and enable flag storage infrastructure for tracking processing stages

**2. Data Model Configuration**
Define non-comparable attributes in the data model and configure product state machine to support amendment workflows for both premium-bearing and non-premium-bearing policies

**3. Amendment Processing**
User is able to initiate policy amendments out of chronological sequence for master and individual policies with appropriate issuance capabilities

**4. Roll-On Delta Analysis**
System retrieves and calculates differences between affecting quote versions and affected policy versions to identify synchronization requirements

**5. Automated Reconciliation**
Upon amendment completion, system automatically or manually merges quote and policy versions based on three-way comparison logic
    5.1 Automatic roll-on applies when predefined rules are met
    5.2 Manual roll-on initiated when administrator review is required

**6. Completion & Validation**
System finalizes roll-on process and validates all affected policies maintain data integrity across the policy hierarchy
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. Business Prerequisite Validation**
Given out-of-sequence amendment capability is being configured, When business validation is performed, Then system only enables functionality if business rules permit OOS processing for the product line

**2. Amendment Submission**
Given a policy requires changes with an earlier effective date than existing amendments, When administrator submits out-of-sequence amendment, Then system accepts and processes the amendment while flagging affected downstream policies

**3. Automatic Roll-On Execution**
Given an amendment meets automatic roll-on criteria, When the amendment is finalized, Then system automatically synchronizes all affected individual policies without manual intervention

**4. Manual Roll-On Workflow**
Given an amendment requires administrator review, When delta analysis identifies conflicts, Then system presents reconciliation options and prevents completion until manual roll-on is executed

**5. Data Integrity Enforcement**
Given roll-on process is in progress, When system detects incomplete or inconsistent data, Then system prevents submission and requires resolution before completing synchronization

**6. Hierarchy Consistency**
Given roll-on completion is triggered, When all merges are finalized, Then system validates master and individual policies reflect consistent attribute values per comparability rules

features.feature: Calculate and Store Age-Based Rating Attributes for Aging Events
features.source_document: GRC_Policy/Policy/Policy Processes and Capabilities/Policy Group Insurance Capabilities/Group Benefits Common Capabilities/Manage Aging & Anniversary Process/TXT_Age, Attained Age, Issue Age.md
features.evidence: Policy saves three age-related attributes for Aging process, which are Issue Age, Age and Attainted Age... Age is calculated by Kraken Rules and Reset Rule should be updated based on the value of 'Age Band Changes'.
features.process_name: Age-Based Rating Attribute Calculation and Storage
features.action: configure and calculate age-based rating attributes for policy lifecycle events
features.value: premiums are accurately calculated based on the appropriate age methodology and anniversary rules
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **configure and calculate age-based rating attributes for policy lifecycle events**,
So that **premiums are accurately calculated based on the appropriate age methodology and anniversary rules**
features.business_context:
- Supports multiple age rating structures (Issue Age, Attained Age) required for different product lines (A&H vs Life products)
- Enables accurate premium calculation by maintaining three distinct age attributes (Issue Age, Age, Attained Age) with different calculation rules
- Addresses complexity of age band change triggers (Immediate, Member Record Anniversary, Master Policy Anniversary) across transaction types
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Initial Age Attribute Establishment**
Upon new business or rewrite transaction, system calculates and stores Issue Age (constant throughout lifecycle), Age (for rating), and Attained Age based on policy effective date minus birth date.

**2. Age Recalculation for Policy Changes**
When amendments or renewals occur, system recalculates age attributes based on Age Band Changes configuration (None, Immediate, or Anniversary-based), with existing insureds retaining values or resetting per rules.

**3. Anniversary-Based Age Adjustments**
If Age Band Changes configured for Member Record or Master Policy Anniversary, system updates Age using anniversary date minus birth date minus one, ensuring age changes align with post-birthday anniversaries.

**4. Aging Event Processing**
When aging events trigger, system recalculates Attained Age using event date minus birth date and stores value in aging flag structure.

**5. Business Rule Enforcement**
System enforces constraint that Age cannot be smaller than Issue Age and applies product-specific display rules for A&H versus Life products.
features.acceptance_criteria:
**1. New Business Age Calculation**
Given a new business transaction, When policy effective date and birth date are provided, Then system calculates and stores Issue Age, Age, and Attained Age as policy effective date minus birth date.

**2. Age Band Changes - None Configuration**
Given existing insured with Age Band Changes set to None, When amendment processed, Then system retains existing Age; Given newly added insured, Then system calculates Age as transaction effective date minus birth date.

**3. Age Band Changes - Immediate Configuration**
Given Age Band Changes configured as Immediate, When amendment transaction processed, Then system resets Age to transaction effective date minus birth date for all insureds.

**4. Age Band Changes - Anniversary Configuration**
Given Age Band Changes set to Member Record or Master Policy Anniversary, When amendment processed, Then system calculates Age as anniversary date minus birth date minus one, ensuring Age remains not less than Issue Age.

**5. Aging Event Attained Age Update**
Given aging event occurs, When system processes aging flag, Then Attained Age recalculated as aging event date minus birth date and stored in aging flag structure.

features.description:

features.business_context:
- Supports self-administered billing models where employers/policyholders manage premium collection on behalf of the insurance company
- Reduces administrative burden on insurance company by delegating billing operations to policyholders while maintaining system control over coverage and premium calculations
- Enables flexible product offerings across dual-billing products (Disability, ACC, HI, CI, GTL) and self-bill-only products (Leave, SMP)
features.key_capabilities:
**1. Administration Model Selection**
User is able to configure Master Policy with 'Is Self Bill' attribute to determine billing administration approach, triggering roster-based processing when enabled.

**2. Roster Record Creation and Management**
User is able to establish roster records containing insured individual information for enrollment, coverage tracking, and claims processing without generating detailed member certificates.

**3. Premium Calculation Processing**
System calculates premiums on roster records using identical lifecycle and calculation methods as member records, maintaining accuracy without master-level aggregation.

System manages billing integration exclusively at master policy level for self-administered arrangements, bypassing individual roster billing workflows.

User is able to apply advanced capabilities (ICP, Change Agency, Premium Waiver) at roster level for dual-billing products; master-only for Leave/SMP products.

Given roster records under self-administered policy, When premium calculation executes, Then system applies identical calculation logic as member records without aggregating to master level.

Given a self-administered group policy, When billing processes trigger, Then system processes billing exclusively at master policy level with no roster-level invoice generation.

**4. Product-Specific Capability Application**
Given dual-billing products (Disability/ACC/HI/CI/GTL), When ICP or Change Agency operations occur, Then system enables roster-level processing; Given Leave/SMP products, Then system restricts to master-only processing.

**5. Lifecycle Operation Parity**
Given roster records, When lifecycle events (renewal/portability/continuation) trigger, Then system executes processes identically to member record workflows.

**6. Product Support Validation**
Given product configuration, When self-bill option selected, Then system prevents GPL selection and allows only supported products (Disability/ACC/CI/HI/Dental/Vision/GTL/Leave/SMP).

    3.2 If values diverge per strategy rules, system invalidates override and reactivates business rule

I want to **configure and trigger business rule execution at defined policy lifecycle entry points**,
So that **I can enforce consistent business logic and regulatory compliance automatically across policy operations without manual intervention**.
features.business_context:
- **Strategic Value**: Enables dynamic business rule enforcement at critical transaction points (quote, bind, endorsement, renewal) ensuring regulatory compliance and operational consistency without code changes
- **Pain Point**: Manual rule application leads to inconsistent decisions and compliance gaps across policy lifecycle stages
- **Pain Point**: Hard-coded business logic requires development cycles to adjust rules for market or regulatory changes
features.key_capabilities:
**Entry Point Configuration**
User is able to define and activate business rule execution triggers at configurable policy lifecycle milestones (application, underwriting, issuance, modification, renewal)

**Rule Engine Invocation**
Upon reaching a configured entry point, system automatically executes applicable business rules based on policy context, product type, and jurisdiction

**Decision Adjudication**
System evaluates rule outcomes and determines next action (approve, refer, reject, modify premium/coverage)

**Exception Handling**
When rule execution fails or produces conflicts, system routes transaction for manual review with full audit context
features.acceptance_criteria:
**Successful Rule Execution**
Given business rules are configured for a policy entry point, When the transaction reaches that milestone, Then system executes all applicable rules and returns determination

**Context-Aware Processing**
Given multiple rule sets exist, When entry point is triggered, Then system applies only rules matching current policy product, jurisdiction, and effective date

**Audit Trail Completeness**
Given rules execute at any entry point, When processing completes, Then system records all rule invocations, inputs, outputs, and decisions for compliance review

**Graceful Failure Management**
Given a rule execution error occurs, When system cannot resolve automatically, Then transaction is suspended and routed to exception queue with diagnostic information

features.source_document: GRC_Policy/Policy/Policy Processes and Capabilities/Policy Personal and Commercial Capabilities/PnC Policy Premium and Prorating/PnC Premium Storage/Flat Premium Model/BE_Policy_PremiumHolder.md
features.evidence: GWT (Gross Written Premium) includes TAXES, FEES, and COMMISSIONS. Formula: GWT = NWT + Taxes + Fees. NWT (Net Written Premium) connects to Adjustment, Discount, and Surcharge. Formula: NWT = RAW + Adjustment - Discount + Surcharges
features.process_name: Calculate Gross Written Premium Including Taxes and Fees
features.action: compute final premium amounts with applicable taxes, fees, and adjustments
features.value: accurate billing amounts are generated reflecting all regulatory and business-driven premium components
features.description:
As a **Policy Administrator**,
I want to **compute final premium amounts with applicable taxes, fees, and adjustments**,
